intro: Luzula acuminata var. carolinae, commonly known as Carolina sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems and a subject of study in ecological botany.
